intro: Protasparagus gharoensis, commonly known as the Gharoensis Asparagus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its slender, spiny stems and small, clustered white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, edible berries that are used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
